name: Adelie Penguin
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Small white circle around each eye
characteristics_slogan: Eats up to 2kg of food per day!
characteristics_predators: Leopard Seal, Skua Gull, Killer Whale

name: African Grey Parrot
characteristics_biggest_threat: Habitat destruction, pet trade, pesticides, hunting
characteristics_other_name(s): Congo grey parrot, grey parrot, Congo African grey parrot
characteristics_lifespan: 23 years in the wild, up to 60 years in captivity
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey, monkeys, terrestrial predators

name: African Penguin
characteristics_slogan: The only penguin species in Africa!

name: Albatross
characteristics_location: The Southern Hemisphere and North Pacific

name: Amazon Parrot
characteristics_estimated_population_siz: The populations of many wild Amazon parrots haven’t been quantified, but 58 percent of these parrots are now considered endangered as of 2021. As of 2020 there were 2361 yellow-naped Amazon parrots, and there are an estimated 9000 to 10,000 red-tailed amazons in the wild. On the other hand, the Imperial amazon is considered critically endangered, and there may be only 50 adult birds in the wild.
characteristics_other_name(s): Sisserou, turquoise-fronted parrot, yellow-shouldered parrot, mercenary amazon, red-tailed parrot, cuca
characteristics_habitat: Woodlands, savannas, rainforests, palm groves, cloud forests, moist forests, mountain forests
characteristics_location: South America, the Caribbean, Mexico, South Africa, Europe

name: American Robin
characteristics_prey: earthworms, caterpillars, grasshoppers, beetle grubs, spiders, and snails
characteristics_predators: birds of prey, snakes, and cats

name: Avocet
characteristics_slogan: Has a curved, upturned beak!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long curved beak and striking plumage

name: Bald Eagle
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The white plumage on the head
characteristics_predators: Wolverines, bobcats, foxes, bears, raccoons, and birds

name: Barn Owl
characteristics_slogan: Found everywhere around the world!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: White heart-shaped face and large, dark eyes

name: Barn Swallow
characteristics_location: North America, South America, Central America

name: Barred Owl
characteristics_prey: Mammals, including house mice and rabbits, other birds, amphibians, reptiles, insects and other invertebrates and even fish.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Its facial disk and huge eyes.
characteristics_other_name(s): Striped Owl, Northern Barred Owl, Hoot Owl, Ol’ Eight-Hooter
characteristics_habitat: Forests, especially old growth forests near bodies of water, wooded swamps
characteristics_weight: Males weigh 1 to 1.8 pounds, females weigh about 1.8 to 2 pounds
characteristics_length: 18.9 inches for males, 20 inches for females
characteristics_predators: Raccoons and weasels, great horned owls, humans
characteristics_nesting_location: Tree cavities, larger abandoned nests, squirrel drays. Barred owls may also choose a nest box.

name: Baya
characteristics_prey: Seeds, grains, insects, frogs, and other animals
characteristics_predators: Lizards, snakes, crows, and birds of prey

name: Bearded Vulture
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Black bristly feathers under its bill

name: Bird Of Paradise
characteristics_slogan: There are around 50 different species!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Brightly coloured feathers and elaborate dance of males

name: Black-Capped Chickadee
characteristics_name_of_young: Hatchling, chick, or fledgling, depending on their stage of development
characteristics_habitat: Forests of deciduous and coniferous trees, gardens, parks, and backyards

name: Blackpoll Warbler
characteristics_location: North America, South America, western Europe
characteristics_nesting_location: in trees- up to 30 feet above the ground

characteristics_location: United States, Mexico, Central America, the Caribbean
characteristics_nesting_location: In small trees, vines, briars or shrubs near an open area

characteristics_biggest_threat: Predators and collision with man-made structures
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: “Jay-jay” sounds while communicating and bright blue feathers

characteristics_favorite_food: Nuts, seeds, acorns, grasshoppers, caterpillars, beetles, eggs, nestlings

characteristics_distinctive_feature: Brightly coloured feathers and warble communication calls

name: Carolina Parakeet
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey, raccoons, skunks, squirrels, and snakes

name: Cassowary
characteristics_slogan: Can reach speeds of 30mph!

characteristics_slogan: There are 7 million breeding pairs!

name: Chipping Sparrow
characteristics_prey: Caterpillars, grasshoppers, other insects, some spiders

characteristics_distinctive_feature: 14 - 16 days after hatching

characteristics_estimated_population_siz: Undetermined, but conservation status is least concern
characteristics_lifespan: As long as 35 years, average between 15 and 25 or longer in captivity

name: Cockatoo
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Crest of feathers on the head
characteristics_location: Australia, New Guinea, Philippines, Indonesia, and Pacific islands
characteristics_slogan: Highly social, smart, and chatty bird.
characteristics_predators: Falcons, eagles, owls, snakes, and cats

name: Common Buzzard
characteristics_slogan: The most common raptor in the UK!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small head and curved beak
characteristics_nesting_location: Tree branch or fork in tree

characteristics_other_name(s): Corby, corbeau, western raven, northern raven

characteristics_predators: Owls, eagles, martens attack their eggs, larger birds of prey such as great horned owls and mammalian carnivores such as coyotes or cougars might prey on younger ravens.
characteristics_nesting_location: Old trees, ledges, cliffs, even utility poles

name: Crane
characteristics_slogan: Many are critically endangered species!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Large body size and long beak

name: Eagle
characteristics_habitat: Open waters like rivers, lakes and coastal regions
characteristics_slogan: Has exceptional eyesight!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long curved beak and strong, sharp claws

name: Eastern Bluebird
characteristics_prey: Insects, snails, spiders, beetles, earthworms, grasshoppers, katydids, crickets and other small invertebrates.
characteristics_biggest_threat: Habitat destruction, invasive species, pet cats
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The bright blue color of the male’s feathers
characteristics_habitat: Habitat includes farmland, open country, parks, orchards, backyards, hedgerows
characteristics_location: North and Central America east of the Rocky Mountains
characteristics_predators: Rodents, black bears, raccoons, snakes, cats, birds of prey and fire ants.
characteristics_nesting_location: Abandoned woodpecker hole or other tree cavities a few feet from the ground.

name: Eastern Phoebe
characteristics_prey: Wasps, bees, flies, grasshoppers, bees, spiders, millipedes, ticks, and other insects.
characteristics_biggest_threat: Brown-headed cowbird, which replaces the egg’s in the Eastern phoebe’s nest with their own.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Wags its tail as it sits.
characteristics_habitat: Forests, swamps, marshes, gardens, streams, and other agricultural areas
characteristics_location: Southeastern United States and northern Mexico
characteristics_predators: Snakes, chipmunks, mice, house wrens, crows, and jays, which predominantly go after the eggs.
characteristics_nesting_location: Under bridges, in barns, and other areas with shelter above and support below.

characteristics_location: The Solomon Islands, Indonesia, New Guinea, Australia, the Moluccas
characteristics_predators: Possums, birds of prey, wild dogs

characteristics_biggest_threat: Hunting due to perception as an invasive species

characteristics_predators: owls , snakes , other raptors and reptiles

characteristics_nesting_location: Cacti, bushes, trees or artificial structures

name: Myna Bird
characteristics_prey: Insects, other small animals including crustaceans, rodents and fish
characteristics_estimated_population_siz: Depends on the species. The population of the common mynah, Acridotheres tristis is unknown, but it is abundant in its range, and its population is increasing. On the other hand, the Bali myna is critically endangered. Scientists believe that less than 100 adult birds are left in the wild.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The ability of some species to speak.
characteristics_other_name(s): Selarang, Teck Meng, Indian myna, Calcutta myna, Mal kawadiya, Sela lihiniya, Kampatiya, Sula magpie, talking myna, common grackle
characteristics_habitat: Extensive, including farms, cities, forests, deserts, open forests, moist forests, mountain forests and dry woodlands, jungles, plantations and dwarf forests

characteristics_nesting_location: In a tree or in river banks

name: Nicobar pigeon

characteristics_biggest_threat: Habitat destruction, hunting, collection for the illegal pet trade
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The colors of its long, iridescent feathers
characteristics_other_name(s): Hackled pigeon, vulturine pigeon or white-tailed pigeon
characteristics_location: Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Solomon Islands, Palau, islands in the Malay Archipelago
characteristics_lifespan: 8 to 12 years in the wild, and 10 to 15 years in captivity

name: Humboldt Penguin
characteristics_slogan: Found on the South American coast!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Pink base of beak and black and white markings

name: Hummingbird
characteristics_slogan: Beat their wings up to 80 times per second!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long, thin beak and the ability to hover
characteristics_nesting_location: Sheltered trees or shrubbery and fork of branches

name: Ibis
characteristics_slogan: Found in swamps, marshes and wetlands!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Rounded body and long neck and beak

name: Ivory-billed woodpecker
characteristics_predators: Raccoons, snakes, owls, crows, and hawks

name: Lyrebird
characteristics_estimated_population_siz: 3500 for Albert’s lyrebird, over 10,000 for Superb lyrebird
characteristics_biggest_threat: Habitat destruction, hunting, invasive species such as red foxes
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The male bird’s skill at mimicry
characteristics_other_name(s): Bulln-bulln, weringerong, woorail for the Superb, northern lyrebird for the Albert’s
characteristics_location: Australia: Victoria, Tasmania and New South Wales for the Superb lyrebird, Queensland for Albert’s lyrebird
characteristics_weight: Superb lyrebirds weigh around 2.14 pounds, Albert’s 2.06 pounds
characteristics_length: 74 to 98 inches long for the Superb, 84 to 90 inches long for Albert’s
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey, including currawongs, foxes, cats and dogs
characteristics_nesting_location: On an earthen mound or among rocks

name: Robin
characteristics_slogan: There are more than 45 species in Australia alone!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small body size and bright red chest of males

name: Shoebill Stork
characteristics_prey: Fish, snakes, frogs, turtles, lizards, and more

name: Tropicbird
characteristics_slogan: Nests on tropical islands and cliffs!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long pointed beak and large body size
characteristics_age_of_molting: Adult feather appear at two to three years

name: Chicken
characteristics_slogan: First domesticated more than 10,000 years ago!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Sharp, pointed beak and clucking sounds

name: Chinese Geese
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Long, arched neck and raised knob
characteristics_location: Kazakhstan, Mongolia, Russia, Japan, South Korea, North Korea, China, Turkmenistan, Laos, Uzbekistan, Taiwan, and Thailand
characteristics_predators: Snakes, rats, raccoons, coyotes, and foxes

name: Cinereous Vulture
characteristics_prey: Calves, kids, lambs, piglets, young birds, rodents, reptiles and amphibians
characteristics_other_name(s): Eurasian black vulture, monk vulture, black vulture
characteristics_habitat: Forests, mountains, semi-deserts, often at heights between 330 and 6562 feet.

name: Common Loon
characteristics_slogan: Also known as the Great Northern Diver
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Large body size and eerie, yodel-like call

name: Crested Penguin
characteristics_slogan: Has long yellow eyebrows!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Red beak and bright yellow eyebrows

name: Cuckoo
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Feet, which are zygodactyl (two inner toes face forward, two outer twos face backward)
characteristics_habitat: Forests, meadows, woodlands, and scrub areas.
characteristics_average_litter_size: 12 and 22 eggs each breeding season, spread among different nests.
characteristics_wingspan: Up to 42 inches for the largest species, the channel-billed cuckoo
characteristics_nesting_location: Trees, bushes, the ground. Some species lay their eggs in other bird's nests.

name: Duck
characteristics_slogan: Rows of tiny plates line their teeth!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long, broad beak and webbed feet

name: Dunnock
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: The dark streaks on the back
characteristics_other_name(s): Hedge accentor, hedge sparrow, or hedge warbler

name: House Finch
characteristics_habitat: Grasslands, deserts, forests, cities, and suburbs
characteristics_predators: Raccoons, skunks, snakes, squirrels, rats, chipmunks, and other birds
characteristics_nesting_location: Tree branches and other high structures

name: Ostrich
characteristics_slogan: The largest bird in the world!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small wings and long neck and legs

name: Purple Finch
characteristics_predators: Cats, dogs, hawks, squirrels, jays, grackles, barn owls, merlins, and American kestrels

name: Red Finch
characteristics_habitat: Desert grassland, open desert, oak savannah, suburban areas, shrubland
characteristics_predators: Domesticated cats, skunks, hawks, raccoons, snakes, rats, Blue jays

name: Rockhopper Penguin
characteristics_slogan: There are 3 different species!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Red beaks and eyes, with yellow head feathers

name: Silkie Chicken
characteristics_age_of_sexual_maturity: Hens- 8 to 10 months, Cockerels- 10 to 12 months
characteristics_age_of_weaning: Wean from heat lamps at 6 weeks
characteristics_predators: Racoons, Bobcats, Foxes, Coyotes, Weasels, Birds of Prey, Skunks, Snakes, and Rodents

name: Woodpecker
characteristics_slogan: There are 200 different species!
characteristics_nesting_location: Holes in the trunks of trees
characteristics_age_of_molting: late summer within the first year

name: Dodo
characteristics_slogan: Native to the island of Mauritius!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Hooked beak and unable to fly
characteristics_age_of_molting: Probably a few weeks or months

name: Golden Oriole
characteristics_slogan: Migrates between Europe and Asia!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Yellow plumage of males and bright red eyes

name: Mourning Dove
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Can be identified by silhouette, whether perched or in-flight
characteristics_location: southwestern US, Mexico, southern Canada, Panama
characteristics_lifespan: 1.5-5 years in the wild, up to 19 years in captivity
characteristics_nesting_location: Trees, shrubs, vines, buildings, hanging flower pots, ground

name: Ruddy Turnstone
characteristics_predators: American mink, Arctic fox, red fox, rats

name: Yellow-Eyed Penguin
characteristics_slogan: The rarest species of penguin!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Bright yellow head-band and pink coloured feet

name: Emperor Penguin
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Bright yellow feathers on neck and ears
characteristics_slogan: The world's largest species of penguin!
characteristics_predators: Southern Giant Petrol, Leopard Seal, Killer Whale

name: Emu
characteristics_habitat: Open grasslands with bushes close to water
characteristics_slogan: The largest bird in Australia!
characteristics_predators: Human, Wild dogs, Birds of prey
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Enormous body size and large eyes

name: Gentoo Penguin
characteristics_slogan: Found throughout the sub-Antarctic!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small head with orange beak and feet

name: Goose
characteristics_habitat: Large ponds, rivers and lake shores
characteristics_slogan: There are 29 different species!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long neck and noisy communication calls

name: Grouse
characteristics_slogan: Feathered legs and toes!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long tail feathers and feathered legs and toes

name: Heron
characteristics_slogan: Inhabits wetlands around the world!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Long thin legs and pointed beak

name: Hoopoe
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Crest of feathers on the head
characteristics_slogan: Stunning bird with a stinky way to deter predators!
characteristics_favorite_food: Ants, grasshoppers, beetles, crickets, and other insects

name: House wren
characteristics_other_name(s): O-du-na-mis-sug-ud-da-we-shi, which is Chippewa for “Big noise for its size.”
characteristics_predators: Cats, rats, opossums, birds of prey, raccoons, squirrels, snakes, woodpeckers
characteristics_nesting_location: Tree cavities, nest boxes, shoes, hats, cans, gourds, holes in walls, scarecrows

name: Junglefowl
characteristics_prey: worms, slugs, insects, mice, small lizards, and frogs
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Bright colors, red crest in males
characteristics_habitat: Field edges, forests, scrubland, mountains, islands
characteristics_lifespan: 3-14 years in the wild, 10-30 years in captivity
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey, land-dwelling carnivorous animals

name: Kestrel
characteristics_prey: Small rodents, lizards, insects, birds, and eggs
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Hunting behavior of hovering and diving
characteristics_other_name(s): Grasshopper hawk, killy hawk, short-winged hawk, windhover, house hawk, and rusty-crowned falcon
characteristics_location: North America, most of South America, Europe, Asia, Africa
characteristics_lifespan: 5 years in the wild, 17 years in captivity
characteristics_predators: Larger birds of prey, snakes, fire ants, and cats
characteristics_nesting_location: Natural cavities, other birds' nests, nesting boxes
characteristics_age_of_molting: The next spring (adults molt in the fall)

name: King Penguin
characteristics_slogan: More than 2 million breeding pairs!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Large body size with yellow markings on head

name: Kingfisher
characteristics_habitat: Lowland freshwater areas and river estuaries
characteristics_slogan: Inhabits wetlands and woodlands worldwide!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small body and long, sharp and straight beaks

name: Little Penguin
characteristics_slogan: The smallest species of penguin!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small body size with blue/grey feathers

name: Lorikeet
characteristics_prey: Flowers, fruit, nectar, pollen, and insects

name: Mississippi Kite
characteristics_prey: Insects, rodents, snakes, birds, bats, frogs, and turtles
characteristics_other_name(s): Mosquito hawk, blue snake-hawk, and hovering kite
characteristics_habitat: Hardwood forests, prairies, and urban environments
characteristics_location: United States, Central and South America
characteristics_predators: Raccoons, snakes, crows, owls, and other birds of prey

name: Moorhen
characteristics_slogan: Feeds on aquatic insects and water-spiders!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Small rounded head and pointed beak

name: Penguin
characteristics_slogan: Spends 75% of it's time hunting for food!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Short, sharp beak and slight webbed feet

name: Pigeon
characteristics_prey: Grain, seeds, berries, fruits, and occasionally insects, snails, earthworms.
characteristics_biggest_threat: Inference from humans either in the form of pest control or urbanization
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: White rump and metallic purple/ green iridescence on males
characteristics_habitat: Often found in towns and cities, as well as farmlands, fields, and rocky cliffs

name: Turkey
characteristics_slogan: Closely related to pheasants and chickens!

name: Vulture
characteristics_habitat: Deserts, savannah and grassland near water
characteristics_slogan: There are 30 different species worldwide!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Large wings and sharp, curved beak
characteristics_main_prey: Rats, Small and large animal carcasses

name: Puffin
characteristics_other_name(s): Atlantic Puffin, Tufted Puffin, Horned Puffin, Rhinoceros Auklet
characteristics_slogan: Can remain in the water for up to 2 minutes!

name: Song Thrush
characteristics_prey: Insects and their larvae, snails, earthworms, slugs
characteristics_habitat: Woods, temperate forests, scrub, shrublands, mountains, farms, gardens, parks
characteristics_location: Europe, North Africa, Middle East, New Zealand, Australia
characteristics_weight: 1.76 to 3.77 ounces, females a bit heavier
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey, cats, dogs, humans
characteristics_nesting_location: In a tree, in shrubs or creepers, on the ground

name: Uguisu
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: Has light-coloured lines above the eyes
characteristics_other_name(s): Japanese Bush-Warbler, Singing Bush-warbler, Oriental Bush-warbler
characteristics_slogan: Their guano is used in face creams!

name: Thrush
characteristics_predators: Raccoons, crows, jays, snakes, cats, squirrels, birds of prey
characteristics_nesting_location: In trees, with the exception of bluebirds, who nest in cavities or nest boxes and hermit thrushes, who often nest on the ground

name: Kiwi
characteristics_slogan: Only found in the forests of New Zealand!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Round body and long, sharp and straight beaks

name: Stork
characteristics_prey: Insects, amphibians, small mammals, bird eggs, fish, crustaceans.
characteristics_biggest_threat: Agricultural changes and industrialization by humans.
characteristics_most_distinctive_feature: long legs, long neck, and long bill
characteristics_habitat: Open grasslands, light woodlands, marshes, wet meadows, rivers, ponds.
characteristics_location: Australia, North America, Africa, Europe, Asia, South America
characteristics_lifespan: 22 years in wild, 35 years in captivity
characteristics_predators: American alligators, though eggs are attacked by small mammals.
characteristics_nesting_location: Cliff sides, trees, and on tops of homes

name: Owl
characteristics_prey: Insects, rodents, rabbits, hares, and fish
characteristics_predators: Birds of prey, cats, and humans

name: Snowy Owl
characteristics_slogan: One of the largest owl species in the world!
characteristics_distinctive_feature: Black and white markings and large head

name: Potoo
taxonomy_scientific_name: Nyctibius bracteatus, Nyctibius grandis, Nyctibius aethereus, Nyctibius leucopterus, Nyctibius maculosus, Nyctibius griseus, Nyctibius jamaicensis
characteristics_prey: Large insects, a bat or small bird occasionally
characteristics_estimated_population_siz: Possibly in the millions, though the population trend of the common potoo is decreasing. The conservation status of the seven species of potoos is least concern.
characteristics_location: South and Central America, Mexico, Hispaniola
characteristics_nesting_location: On a hollow in a tree limb
